summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 discussing the approval process for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein to begin therapy. FBI agents and a victim services program manager correspond about confirming the individual's status as a confirmed victim and the justification for FBI Victim Assistance Program (FEVAF) funding for her counseling.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, who states the victim was identified in the original case file but not interviewed by them.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: A program manager within the FBI's Victim Services Division who questions the justification for FEVAF funding for the victim's counseling and requests details.

persons.name: M.S., L.M.H.C., C.S.A.
persons.context: A licensed psychotherapist certified in sexual abuse trauma, based in Greenacres, Florida, who informs the FBI that she will begin treating the victim for her victimization by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', he is identified as the perpetrator of the victimization for which the individual is seeking therapy.

connections.description: The psychotherapist states she will treat a client for victimization by Jeffrey Epstein.
Both are FBI employees corresponding about victim services approval.

events.title: Scheduled therapy session for Epstein victim
events.description: A licensed psychotherapist schedules to begin treatment for an individual regarding her victimization by Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: An individual identified as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein from the original case file was seeking therapy in late 2020, years after the initial investigations.
FBI Victim Services personnel were involved in approving and funding counseling for this victim through the FEVAF program.
The victim had been approved for services previously but had not yet begun treatment, indicating ongoing support needs long after the abuse.
The email chain shows internal FBI protocol and scrutiny for authorizing victim assistance funds.
